Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary:
Requested by @lotus063 
[Y/S/N] = your son’s name
You and Carol had been in a very loving relationship. The son you two had...
body:
Requested by @lotus063

[Y/S/N] = your son’s name

You and Carol had been in a very loving relationship. The son you two had together only made things better. Sadly, your happy family would come tumbling down when you received the news about Carol’s supposed death. These events sent you into a deep grief stricken state and to make things more difficult you were left to raise your young son alone. It would be a lie to say that for some time you felt extremely hopeless.

In the past two years or so though, things started to look up. You met a new partner and your son was growing up to be happy and healthy. He had been far too young at the time of Carol’s death to remember her too much which was almost for the better so that he didn’t feel as much sadness about the situation as you had been.

Little did you know that your life would take a sudden and unexpected turn. Carol would show up on your doorstep, back from the dead. You couldn’t believe it but nevertheless you let her in and she told you this story that was too much to believe. It took Carol actually showing you get powers for you to believe that her being taken by these aliens called the Kree was real. “But now i’m back” Carol concluded. “And I remember everything… where’s [Y/S/N]?”.

“About that, he’s at school. My wife… my new wife’s picking him up” you said, regrettably breaking the news to Carol. “You can see him when they back but I should warn you. I doubt he’ll remember who you are”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

summary: It’s lovely to see how Carol Danvers’s agency is given back, slowly, bit by bit. I mean, in the beginning there was this “girl,”...
body:
It’s lovely to see how Carol Danvers’s agency is given back, slowly, bit by bit.

I mean, in the beginning there was this “girl,” unconscious as the Pscyhe-Magitron blew, not knowing she was given superpowers. A “girl” who was unaware of her own superhero persona. A “girl” whose body and mind were repeatedly violated.

But then she reconciled her civilian and super alter ago.

And then she was conscious when the Psyche-Magitron blew, and wished for powers.

And then she was physically there, in the past, and could have decided to stop everything, but in the end she choose the powers.

(And then, in the movie, she decided to blow up the power source herself.)

And then the source of her powers wasn’t the Psyche-Magitron anymore. No, it was her birthright.

And then she decided to sacrifice her memories, to save millions of people, instead of her memories being ripped from her.

And now, thanks to @1979semifinalist, she was able to decide, on her own, to let Rogue absorb her. 

She’s really the master of her fate now.

I mean, in the beginning there was this “girl,” unconscious as the Pscyhe-Magitron blew, not knowing she was given superpowers. A “girl” who was unaware of her own superhero persona. A “girl” whose body and mind were repeatedly violated.

But then she reconciled her civilian and super alter ago.

And then she was conscious when the Psyche-Magitron blew, and wished for powers.

And then she was physically there, in the past, and could have decided to stop everything, but in the end she choose the powers.

(And then, in the movie, she decided to blow up the power source herself.)

And then the source of her powers wasn’t the Psyche-Magitron anymore. No, it was her birthright.

And then she decided to sacrifice her memories, to save millions of people, instead of her memories being ripped from her.

And now, thanks to @1979semifinalist, she was able to decide, on her own, to let Rogue absorb her. 

She’s really the master of her fate now.

tags: when movies are filmed out of order
summary: Why Captain Marvel Has on More Make-Up in Endgame Than Her Solo Movie
title: Why Captain Marvel Has on More Make-Up in Endgame Than Her Solo Movie
excerpt: What’s up with the make-up? That’s what fans wanted to know after the second trailer for Avengers: Endgame, which finally added Captain Marvel into the manic mix of superheroes. Many noticed that in her solo outing, which was directed by a man and a woman, Carol Danvers didn’t wear much make-up, but in Endgame, which is directed by two men, she was glammed up. Questions arose regarding the perspectives of the different directors.
description: To summarize, Endgame was filmed before Captain Marvel. Brie Larson and her hair/make up team originally decided to have this look above for Carol in Endgame, but later changed it once she really got a sense for who Carol was as a person once they started working on Captain Marvel.

reblog.comment: To summarize, Endgame was filmed before Captain Marvel. Brie Larson and her hair/make up team originally decided to have this look above for Carol in Endgame, but later changed it once she really got a sense for who Carol was as a person once they started working on Captain Marvel.

Brie Larson and her hair/make up team originally decided to have this look above for Carol in Endgame, but later changed it once she really got a sense for who Carol was as a person once they started working on Captain Marvel.

summary: Carol (brie larson) for the character thing.
question: Carol (brie larson) for the character thing.
answer:
I’m mixing MCU and Comics!Carol for this, so it’s a mashup

general opinion:  Actual Love of my Life
hotness level: Theoretically Hot But Not My Type
hogwarts house: Gryffindor
best quality: Toughness
worst quality: Impulsiveness
ship them with: James Rhodey Rhodes, Marian Rambeau, Maria Hill, Steve Rogers, Thor Odinson
brotp them with: Kamala Khan, Tony Stark, Jessica Drew, Peter Parker
needs to stay away from: Loki, Miles Morales
misc. thoughts: Look, if you don’t adore her and think she’s amazing, then we can’t be friends, and that’s just how it is

summary: who’s your favorite marvel character and why?
question: who’s your favorite marvel character and why?
answer:
Cash, this is so old. I finally got around to emptying my inbox and I’m sorry about answering this so late.

My favourite character has to be Steve Rogers. I mean have you seen the guy with his “I can do this all day” to his ripping a piece of wood with his bare hands and not leaving any man behind attitude to “I’m with you till the end of the line.” Also, the elevator scene in Winter Soldier. Enough said.

Carol Danvers is becoming a close second. She’s cute and quirky and hilarious and so damn witty. Not to mention, she’s a total badass and her “I don’t need to prove anything to you.” An icon.

I love them both so much. Words can’t express it.

summary: The reason Carol’s character arc in Captain Marvel flew over so many people’s heads is because they won’t accept any arc for a...
body: The reason Carol’s character arc in Captain Marvel flew over so many people’s heads is because they won’t accept any arc for a female character other than “….I… I’m s-so sorryry… I fucked up…. I’m shit… I was sh-shit…. I’ll be better now…. I-I’m so sowwy…. 😢”
